column3: FYI These are syscalls and system lib deps that shoud be available to any linux distro running 2.6.32+.\n
Can you create a forum thread about this?\n
Isn't it possible to use setcap to choose exactly which capabilities shall be kept and which shall be drop ?\nWhat's the point of modifying them from bitcoin code ?\n

I just don't see many other security-related/crypto-related programs using this, and guarding against running as root is really tilting at windmills.  There is a long list of dumb things you should not do, such as run wallet software as root, and I think it's low on the priority list, as it does not seem to be a prime attack vector.\n

This has nothing to do with guarding against running as root. That is just a side effect?!\n\nAlso, quite a bit of software uses these mechanisms. For instance: (off the top of my head) bind uses it. The entirety of the priv escalation code in the kernel (setuid binary processing, etc) uses it.
